original_title: Sri Lanka in discussion with JICA to export ayurvedic medication
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has completed the first phase of discussions with Japan’s International Cooperation Agency (JICA) to export ayurvedic medication, a top official from the State Ministry of Indigenous Medicine Promotion said.
“The first phase with JICA has been done, we have yet to compromise a plan on marketing and the groups we are selling to,” the official asking anonymity said.
“There are several phases we will have to go through before we can start exporting,” the official said.
“The next phase is identifying interested companies and bringing out the links of exporting, which will then go to  testing and approving of products,” the official said.
The main objective of the discussion is to export the products of Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Pharmaceutical Corporation to foreign countries,” a statement from the Department of Government Information said.

“With the existing issues in technology, machinery and market, the Japanese International Cooperation (JICA) and JI Promotions (Pvt) Ltd also expressed their agreement to provide Sri Lanka the needed support,” the statement said.

“They also agreed to establish marketing promotion centers of Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Pharmaceutical Corporation in Japan, informed business institutions in Japan to sell and advertise local and Ayurveda products,” the statement said.  (Colombo/July01/2023)
